page.title: 08COWS AT HILL FARM,THURGARTON
page.content: There are 300 milk cows which yield about 7000 litres per day.The cows are selected not only for udder quality but for calving ease:artificial insemination is used via straws of semen and the annual calf enables each cow to produce about 6000 l. over the 300 day "in-milk" period each year. The twice daily milking in the two herring-bone parlours is done by sophisticated machinery which even throws off the "cluster" when the cow is dry.Each cow is given cow cake up to a maximum of 8kg per day depending on its milk yield. There are 200 heifers,also Freisians, being grown on to milking age. Slurry,used as fertilizer on the fields,has to be pumped out from the pits beneath the sheds-about 3000 gallons a day when the cows are inside during the winter.
